snippet: President Obama abruptly changed course by asking lawmakers, who are not due to return to town for more than a week, to give him authorization before he launches a limited military strike against Syria.
abstract: Pres Obama abruptly changes course and postpones military strike against Syrian government so he can first seek authorization from a deeply skeptical Congress; is effectively daring lawmakers to either stand by him or, as he puts it, allow Syrian Pres Bashar al-Assad to get away with murdering children with chemical weapons.

byline.original: By PETER BAKER and JONATHAN WEISMAN
byline.contributor: Jennifer Steinhauer and Jonathan Martin contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: President Obama abruptly changed course by asking lawmakers, who are not due to return to town for more than a week, to give him authorization before he launches a limited military strike against Syria.

headline.sub:
Makes Political
Gamble to Win
Support for Strikes
headline.main: Obama Seeks Approval by Congress for Strike in Syria
headline.print_headline: Slowing March to Military Action, Obama Seeks Syria Vote in Congress
